meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being regarded or treated as more important than others.
meanings.sent1: Finishing homework before playing games is a priority for me.
meanings.sent2: In emergencies, saving lives takes priority over everything else.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think that getting treats was the top priority in the house.
meanings.sent4: During the storm, finding shelter became the highest priority for the hikers.
meanings.sent5: For the firefighter, rescuing people is always the number one priority.

meanings.definition: Something given or meriting attention before competing alternatives.
meanings.sent1: Eating breakfast is a priority to start the day right.
meanings.sent2: When packing for the trip, remembering the passport is a top priority.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made finding nuts its main priority for the day.
meanings.sent4: In the race, crossing the finish line first was the ultimate priority.
meanings.sent5: For the student, studying for the exam is the most important priority right now.
